channel.title: jQuery Events on JavaScript
channel.description: Recent content in jQuery Events on JavaScript

item.title: Events Handlers
item.description: Event Handlers Event handlers are blocks of code (usually a user-defined JavaScript function) that will be run when an event fires There are two parts to an event handler: an event listener and a callback function. An event listener is a method that listens for a specified event to occur, like a click event A callback function is a function that executes when something triggers the event listener

item.title: Other Events
item.description: Other Events There are many other events available, click here to see a complete list of jQuery Events
